CatDescriptText: W.M. Christian, laborer, 1451 Mill Street, Wilkinsburg, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "Yes. And the reason is because they are citizens of the United States and American and should have the same equal rights."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of W.M. Christian wearing trench coat buttoned at neck, moustache, goatee, and dark hat with light colored braided trim, standing in front of Bud Saunder's flower store in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
